content.description: Starts 10' to the left of Black Plastic, going up the middle of the face.  Laeger & Knuckles originally had 2 bolts placed, but I don't recall seeing any when I was trying to decipher where the route was.
content.protection: Cams 1.5 - 3"; were there originally 2 bolts on this?  Still there?  Or was Mr Laeger describing an entirely different line in the thread for BPS?  Is it possible this line is waaay farther left than we think?  -- I just noticed a photo in Miramontes' 2d Ed with a stray 'X' on the wall out to the left of Dead Man's Party; any chances this is Laeger's route?

content.description:
You are made to respect this route early, as you have to crawl to the base, located in an alcove.  The exposure starts here, with the alcove 30 feet above the talus, and the valley spread out a few hundred feet below.

A stiff layback starts out the route, keep pulling until you feel the opposite wall at your back.  Continue to the handrail, traverse into the light, and contemplate the move over the roof.  The exposure is thrilling at this point, enjoy it.  Pull the move, clipping the bolts, and clamber to the top.

Descend via a chimmney to the back (Wild Gravity) of the formation.
content.protection: Good range from finger sized to 3-4 inch, 2 bolts (1/4", 5/16").

content.description: I don't have much recollection of the details of this, but it had a little spice on lead.
content.protection: 3 bolts.  Miramontes mentions 'thin rack' but I don't recall using any gear.
content.location: Approx 60' left of the crawl-thru for Imaginary Voyage route.  From the base of Black Plastic Streetwalker (the first bolted line), continue left past the jog in the wall.

climbs.name: Black Plastic Streetwalker
climbs.fa: M. Lechlinski, R. Walling, J. May and the Manx

content.description:
This is the first route to the left of Imaginary Voyage (before the crawl-thru), which follows 4 bolts near the arete (eventually you roll onto the arete).  Retrobolted.  The original line (graded 5.9) starts in the middle of the face, and slings a knob, before heading considerably to the right.  The new bolted version starts low and to the right, getting some exposure on funky bouldery moves (easier if you're shorter) before heading up.

Note that Miramontes and other guidebooks have Black Plastic Streetwalker switched with Lessons from Laeger.  Lessons from Laeger starts farther left, over near the wide crack.
content.protection: 4 bolts + small cams.  Sling a horn or use gear as allowed, depending on your choice of start.
